intro: Malesherbia taltalina, commonly known as the Taltal bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of northern Chile. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky slopes. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
